Description: A highly contagious viral disease that affects dogs, especially puppies. It causes severe gastrointestinal symptoms, such as vomiting, diarrhea, and dehydration.
Also known as cat flu, it is a common viral or bacterial infection that affects the respiratory system of cats. Symptoms include sneezing, coughing, nasal discharge, and fever.

A parasitic infection transmitted through mosquito bites. Heartworms affect dogs and, less commonly, cats. It can lead to heart and lung damage, causing symptoms like coughing, difficulty breathing, and fatigue.
A bacterial infection transmitted by ticks. It affects dogs, cats, and humans. Symptoms may include lameness, fever, loss of appetite, and swollen joints.
Common in both dogs and cats, dental diseases include conditions like periodontal disease, gingivitis, and tooth decay. It can lead to pain, bad breath, tooth loss, and systemic health issues.
Dogs and cats can develop UTIs, which are often caused by bacteria. Symptoms may include frequent urination, difficulty urinating, blood in urine, and urinary accidents.
Many pets suffer from allergies, which can manifest as itching, redness, rashes, and recurrent ear infections. Allergens can include fleas, pollen, certain foods, or environmental factors.
